TITLE: Sr. Analog Mixed Signal Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: MS in EE with a minimum of 8 years experience in the field of I/O mixed signal circuit design and/or PLL design and clocking architecture. The ideal candidate will have designed high-speed serial interfaces or I/O designs such as DDR, USB, MIPI etc. The candidate would understand what transistor characteristics are needed to get the best performance. The candidate would need to be very familiar with design tools and should be able to debug issues with tool setups process files etc Ability to summarize data in graphical forms is highly desired. A good understanding of I/O layouts is required.

TITLE: Systems Validation Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: BSEE/MSEE or equivalentMinimum 4 years of experience in system validationKnowledge in PCIe protocols and relevant test equipment - MustGood knowledge in IC validation methodologies and experience in conducting test & measurements for various IC parametersGood knowledge in PCB board design is an added advantageExperience in developing programming languages such as Python, C-programmingExperience in handling various high speed test and measurement equipmentExperience in DDR (DDR5/DDR4/LPDDR5/LPDDR4) architecture and testing is an added advantage
DESCRIPTION: Intel NEX Cloud Networking (NCNG) team delivers best-in-class Ethernet products and is at the heart of Intel's transformation from a PC company to a company that powers the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing-devices. NCNG's compelling Ethernet products move the world's data and are the foundations of cloud service and telecommunications data centers. We are a team of problem solvers, experimenters, and innovators who are dedicated to designing the network technologies that currently lead and continue to transform datacenter ecosystems. As a world-class organizationץ We're looking for outstanding talent to accelerate our growth during an exciting time in Ethernet networking marketing technology. If you're ready to be a part of this journey, then we want to hear from you. You will be involved in the IC validation, platform and infrastructure enablement works of PCIe interface in SoC devices that include some of the following responsibilities: - Develop new device validation strategies, plans and schedules for PCIe interface - Collaborate with PCB board design team to develop high speed engineering PCB Board - Design and generate test & measurement programs to validate the new device PCIe performance

TITLE: SOC microarchitect
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications: - BSc. in electrical/Computer Engineering (MSc. An advantage) - 10+ Years of proven track record as logic designer, owning large design including its microarchitecture. - Problem solver and technical path finder. - Writing micro-architecture and Design documents. - RTL coding with Verilog/system Verilog - Firm knowledge in the VLSI design flow, DFT, backend, verification. - Previous experience leading/Designing ARM based SoC's - Team player, ability to work in a dynamic environment and guide team members. Expert in one or more of the following: - Clocks and resets design and distribution at SoC level - SoC fabrics, interconnects and coherent fabrics - Deep understanding of the AMBA protocols (AXI, ACE, APB,AHB) - Familiar with security subsystems (HW-Security-Module), designing one is a advantage. - Own, generate, design system peripherals: UART, SPI, Timers, WDT, memory controllers , GPIO, IO muxes etc. - Familiar with Fuse controller - Post silicon design for debug (DFD) Advantage: - Management / technical lead experience - Backend and synthesis tools experience - DFT experience
DESCRIPTION: Intel Ethernet Products Group (EPG) delivers best-in-class Ethernet products and is part of the Connectivity Group which is at the heart of Intel's transformation from a PC company to a company that powers the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing-devices. EPG's compelling Ethernet products move the world's data and are the foundations of cloud service and telecommunications data centers. We are a team of problem solvers, experimenters, and innovators who are dedicated to designing the network technologies that currently lead and continue to transform datacenter ecosystems. As a world-class organization, we're looking for outstanding talent to accelerate our growth during an exciting time in Ethernet networking marketing technology. If you're ready to be a part of this journey, then we want to hear from you.

TITLE: Senior DFT Engineer

TITLE: Sales Account Manager
QUALIFICATIONS: You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. This Position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or any related field.5+ years of experience working with OEM's (Original Equipment Manufacturer) in the Semiconductor or System Segment Preferred Qualifications: Direct Sales Experience selling directly to OEM customers in the high performance computing segment.
DESCRIPTION: Be part of the Intel team of other Sales Account Managers on the Hewlett Packard Enterprise account. The successful candidate will partner with Sales Applications Engineer(s) to align new Intel technologies and product roadmaps to the customer's technology, product, and business strategies. Candidate will be responsible but not limited for: Driving new sales opportunities for Intel with HPE Greenlake , specifically focused on the High Performance Computing and Mission Critical Server segment .Identifying, developing, and managing the design-in, validation, testing, pre-production ramp, and go to market strategies, while jointly developing the business outcome based messaging resulting in time to market success. This customer business unit is building the solutions for digital transformation using new data-intensive workloads and real-time analytics which now operate at an unprecedented scale. This position requires exceptional management of the existing and emerging revenue pipeline, resulting in billed revenue either direct or through HPE authorized channel partners. Success results in a global product portfolio available for customers to select for their regional markets. Sells full Intel product portfolio across all of Intel's business units and also jointly develops the customer working level and executive relationships, and collaborates with ecosystem partners such as distributors, OEMs, and ISVs in support HPE related activities. Collaborates with internal teams and external partners to identify growth opportunities through account planning and delivery execution. Gathers customer feedback of assigned accounts to understand the drivers of satisfaction and/or dissatisfaction. Determines the root cause for issues/risks and establishes recovery action plans as needed to improve customers' overall experience. Note: This is a commissioned sales position. **

TITLE: Student Sales Development Representative (SDR)
QUALIFICATIONS: Qualifications and Experience:Bachelor's / Master's degree student (at least 3 semesters until graduation). Native level of written and spoken English - a must (Any additional language is a huge plus).A desire to be in a software sales (full cycle) position as a career progression.A passion for technology, in particular deep technology.Ability to multitask and prioritize large lists of leads.Ability to make outbound calls and send out targeted emails on a daily basis.Strong written communication, phone, presentation, and interpersonal skills.A hard-working team player that is motivated to exceed expectationsAdvantages:Proficient with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, Hubspot)Experience with ML, AI, and Data products.An eagerness to work in an ever-changing, fast-paced startup environmentSales experience in SaaS companies - Major AdvantageExperience with lead follow-up work, responding to and qualifying leads from marketing-generated campaigns and web inquiriesExperience in an SDR/BDR role
DESCRIPTION: cnvrg.io is transforming AI and data science with a code-first platform helping the world's largest companies scale their machine learning with an unparalleled end-to-end solution.We are looking for a Student Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team. The SDR will be responsible for identifying and creating new qualified opportunities for their Account Executive counterparts. As an SDR, you will have the opportunity to work with a talented and experienced team and contribute to the company's growth and success.Get your foot in the door as a Sales Development Representative in cutting-edge AI technology. You'll learn practical tools and strategies for driving sales such as CRM proficiencies, prospecting, qualifying, and account based targeting. The scope of our work includes but is not limited to Base build (BB), Progressive Build (PB), Tool Install (TI) for new factories and site infrastructure. We are looking for world class diverse technical talent to join our team. If you enjoy working with the latest technology in a rewarding, fast-paced environment, this is the right place for you. Everywhere you go, you'll find an opportunity to make a difference. In any given workday, you will be given responsibility to innovate and create an impact to our business. As a Construction Project Manager your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Plan and deliver base build construction projects using multiple delivery and execution strategies (From project initiation through to closeout, including the development and management of project scope, schedules, budgets, contracting and compensation strategies, EHS and IIF program, quality program, project controls and change management).Ensure that the project is always in compliance with Construction Management Practices and adheres to Base build standard operating procedures. Projects include disciplines such as mechanical, process, process specialty, electrical, architectural, cleanroom, IT, life safety, and Instrumentation and Controls.Interact and partner with internal customer management; resource plan the project; provide direction to the Base build project teams; have a sound knowledge of the project and construction contracts; and will partner with Tool Install, Corporate Operations, and the Factory to develop and manage an integrated plan that will achieve project objectives and commitments.Build and drive safety culture of caring in every business environment, office to the construction sites, and from front-end planning to construction execution.Champion and value the safety culture of caring throughout the project lifecycle.

and remain in full compliance of policies, margin and audit requirements.� Day to Day Supporto Ensure Sales Operations, Business Management, Customer Operations, Channel Management and Channel Finance are supported as necessary for quoting activity and price transactions.o Support pricing tools working closely with the responsible business and IT owners, to manage the integrity, operation, and enhancement of tools.Secondary Responsibilities include but not limited to:� Pricing Policies and Processeso Champion innovation within the team and beyond to simplify, streamline, strengthen, standardize, and systemize our PSG pricing policies, procedures, and use of pricing tools in a way that ensures execution excellence.� Projectso Help define and then execute implementation plans for complex issues or projects where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth knowledge of PSG systems and processes, e.g., Enhanced reporting and analytics, complex price increases, new business processes, new margin plans.Desired Competencies� Strong personal and professional judgement and interpersonal skills� Analytical, Adaptable, and organized� Attention to detail and process oriented� Excellent verbal and written communication and listening skills� Ability to work independently, under pressure, and meet deadlines� Identify issues, desire to get to root cause and provide solutions� Managing and prioritization of multiple tasks and projects simultaneously� Work across multiple teams, geos, and organizations effectively

TITLE: Senior Firmware Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Electrical / Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Math,Physics, or in a STEM related field of study 10+ years of embedded firmware development expertise using C / C++Experience on networking devices, debugging firmware and embedded hardware modulesExperience in low level programming, operating systems, system architecture design, and hardware design Preferred Qualifications: Post Graduate degreeExperience with RDMA technologyExperience in networking protocols (InfiniBand, TCP/IP, or RoCE)Experience in high-speed ASIC or SOC design and debug (Verilog, fsdb)Experience in post-silicon debugExperience in SOC emulation
DESCRIPTION: NEX Cloud Networking Group (NCNG) delivers best-in-class Ethernet products which is at the heart of Intel's transformation from a PC company to a company that powers the cloud and billions of smart, connected computing-devices. NCNG's compelling Ethernet products move the world's data and are the foundations of cloud service and telecommunications data centers. We are a team of problem solvers, experimenters, and innovators who are dedicated to designing the network technologies that currently lead and continue to transform datacenter ecosystems. As a world-class organization, we're looking for outstanding talent to accelerate our growth during an exciting time in Ethernet networking marketing technology. If you're ready to be a part of this journey, then we want to hear from you. Firmware is at the heart of what makes embedded systems work. As a Remote Direct Memory Access (RDMA) Firmware Engineer, you will be responsible for the design, implementation, and testing of the low-level C/C++ code that powers the networking devices of tomorrow. Join our RDMA IP team as a Senior Firmware Engineer where you are responsible for all aspects of firmware development for this cutting edge, complex IP. In this role, your daily agenda will be exciting. On a regular basis, it will include but not limited to: Developing embedded software within environments that have constrained timing and memory resources, designs and implements reusable code, performs design and code reviews, as well as tests and validates product implementationsInfluences the shaping of future products by significantly contributing to the firmware architecture used across design familiesPerforming system level design and modeling, managing the firmware design environment- Interface definition and partition between software, firmware, and hardwareWorking with a variety of storage interface standardsInterfacing with architecture, design, and system validation stakeholdersExemplifying leadership skills including the skillfulness to organize and prioritize their work- Flexibility adaptability in a fast paced and dynamic environment

DESCRIPTION: Join Intel and build a better tomorrow! We create world-changing technology that improves the life of every person on the planet every day in ways that you probably don’t even see from technology inside self-order kiosks at fast food outlets to the data centers and networks that support your video streaming; from AI enabling genomic sequencing and personalized healthcare to autonomous driving. You’ll be joining a company that values every individual and strives to minimize our impact on the planet – we have just announced that we are water positive in 3 countries and use 100% green energy in our US & European facilities. We have big ambitions and a passion to work with other and address world challenges no one can tackle alone. We would love you to be part of this! If you're passionate about computer graphics and working with top graphics engineers on Intel's latest GPU hardware designs, then our Accelerated Computing Systems and Graphics group (AXG) has opportunities for you. In AXG we are focused on delivering Best-in-Class visual experiences that enable users to immerse themselves in a new visual future. We develop graphics, media, display & imaging solutions for a range of platforms from traditional PC clients to high-end data center servers. Currently the new AXG Graphics Design team is looking for Verification Tech Lead / Verification Manager to drive the new pre-SiVerification team located in Katowice, Poland. The Graphics HW team will focus on a specific graphics hardware subsystem and contribute throughout the entire product lifecycle - starting from feature definition through design, development and validation of new graphics hardware features. The team will be closely cooperating with architects and software/hardware engineering teams to drive innovation and research & development of Intel graphics products in a holistic and global approach.The Verification Tech Lead/Manager will directly report to a Senior Manager located in Poland. In addition, the Leader’s strategic objective is to grow the hardware team in Poland, increase organizational maturity and scope of influence in line with the global strategy of Intel Corporation. In this role you will also manage all day-to-day aspects of team operations including people and performance, financial and general office management issues.

DESCRIPTION: As the PSG Western Regional Field Applications Engineering (FAE) Manager you will set priorities for the Western Regional FAE team, get results across boundaries, ensure an inclusive work environment, develop employees, and manage performance. You will partner with the PSG Western Regional Sales Manager to help lead the entire PSG Western sales team to developing and execute strategies to aggressively grow FPGA Design Wins and increase Intel's FPGA market share.As the PSG Northeast Regional Field Applications Engineering (FAE) Manager you will set priorities for the Northeast Regional FAE team, get results across boundaries, ensure an inclusive work environment, develop employees, and manage performance. You will partner with the PSG Northeast Regional Sales Manager to help lead the entire PSG Northeast sales team to developing and execute strategies to aggressively grow FPGA Design Wins and increase Intel's FPGA market share.Your ability to build strong and influential relationships with decision makers and key stakeholders at your customers and within Intel will be critical to your success in this role. You will drive results by leading a professional sales process and championing a culture of continuous improvement throughout the team. You will be responsible for developing the individuals on the FAE team as well as planning the deployment and account assignments for the FAEs.Strong technical acumen, an ability to lead without authority outside your organization, and a history of driving a deliberate and professional sales process are essential to your success. Customer process knowledge on development, integration, testing, and market deployment of complex systems is critical. Knowledge of FPGA usage models, design flows, tools and IP or a strong knowledge of cloud and enterprise server usage models, software development flows and acceleration will be a plus.As a member of the PSG North America management team, you will contribute to NA wide growth strategies, FAE deployment strategies, and process development and execution.The Northeast region includes New England, The Upper Midwest, and Eastern Canada. Responsibilities Provide technical leadership and an evolving skill set to adapt to Intel innovation and evolving markets;Manage the Design Win business to outperform targetsProvide a current, accurate DWIN forecast and opportunity pipelineDevelop the skills of your team to meet the evolving technology and needs of the customer base as well as the FAEs' individual career goalsIncrease customer adoption while enabling partners and customers to own and control their design IP;Drive solid sales processes, specifically engaging with customer leadership on collaborative support models that accelerate customer deployment and quick time to revenue while managing Cost of Sales (COS) and growth;Target, visit and build influential relationships at top accountsAdditional Responsibilities:Drive collaborative sales efforts across PSG/SMG sales;Identify and develop new ways to grow through share gain and market expansion Note: This is a commissioned sales position.

TITLE: Sr Customer Enablement and Support Engineer - Automotive

DESCRIPTION: At Intel, Design Enablement (DE) is one of the key pillars enabling Intel to deliver winning products in the marketplace. Your will directly drive and work with DE cross teams to enable Intel's technology leadership on automotive platform and product. You will work with automotive customers to outline critical requirements, collaborate with Intel internal partners to define the scope, plan execution, and innovate competitive solutions to meet customer needs. You will drive design methodology for automotive applications and lead automotive customer support. You will bring and leverage your automotive design experience to Intel to analyze the gaps between Intel technologies and automotive-specific needs. Consistently working with customers to clarify the spec, outline critical needs, and work with DE teams to plan and develop design solutions or methodologies for automotive customers. You will be the driver across DE teams for automotive standard spec/criteria in the following areas but not limit to: foundation libs std cell, SRAM, or PDKs in terms of automotive-specific DRC rules, Electromigration rules, Aging modeling, or Automotive ASIC chip implementation, and signoff criteria. As a DEAS (Design Enablement Application and Support) key member, you will need to have good communication skills to interact with customers directly, apply analytical problem-solving capability to identify the key requests, root-causing the issue, and do teamwork with DE stakeholders to support and enable customers successfully. Candidate must exhibit the following behavioral traits/skills: Communication to manage comprehensive, face-paced customer requests, and feedback and self-motivated to drive/collaborate with cross teams to plan/deliver solutions.Analyze issues, solve problems, and bring closure.Customer-oriented mindset. #DesignEnablement

TITLE: Software and Services Pricing Manager
QUALIFICATIONS: You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. This Position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Minimum qualifications: Bachelor degree or higher 4+ years of experience with one or more of the following: Pricing for Software, Pricing for services and/or Pricing for subscriptions.2+ years of previous pricing experience at a technology company Preferred qualifications: Previous experience with customer negotiations
DESCRIPTION: Want to help stand-up one of Intel's new businesses? Intel is a software powerhouse and has been one of the largest contributors to the open source community for over a decade. We have also been consistently bringing small amounts of revenue into the corporation, but we have been challenged to grow this revenue by 10x. SMG added a Software and SaaS pillar in mid-year to drive both GTM and Sales in support of the 10x goal and BMG are looking to add to our team as we ramp up the number of pricing engagements that we undertake. You will be joining a team that has been partnering with incubation teams across the company to stand up new business models within the Intel environment over the past 3+ years and can pull on the collective experiences across both BMG and SMG in ensuring we meet the expectations that we set with our customers. Not only will you be supporting point solutions, but you will also be helping to build out the cumulative knowledge base at Intel on how we structure agreements in these markets, giving you the opportunity to influence beyond the projects that you are directly assigned to. This role will primarily support pricing for roadmap pricing for software, services and subscription products across the company. Project engagements may vary from short consulting projects, to driving the pricing structure from 6-12 months prior to launch, through pilot phases and into commercial rollout. It will require partnering with the Business Unit, Sales, Finance, and Business Management to understand the capabilities of the product being offered and build out pricing models by triangulating customer generated value, competitive information, and financial data. In addition to pricing, this role may also support negotiations and operationalization for these businesses. Responsibilities may include but not be limited to: Roadmap pricing for multiple segments across Intel divisionsBuild out TCO models to be able to highlight the value of new solutions to customersPartner with Business Unit, Sales, and Finance to identify value-based pricing driversConduct research and perform competitive pricing analysesProject impact of pricing decisions, programs, and promotionsContribute to the cumulative knowledge base on software, service, and subscription businessesAligning with other Business Management Group teams In addition to the qualifications a successful candidate will demonstrate: The ability to operate in an ambiguous environment and a passion/willingness to lean in and help the business growThe ability to build partnerships at multiple levels within the organizationExperience with creating new Software/SaaS/Services pricing modelsExcellent communication and influencing skillsDemonstrated business and strategic acumen with an understanding of market drivers and trendsAn analytical mindset and the ability to develop models that enable the BUs short and long term goals

TITLE: GPU Software Development Engineer – Run-Time (Hybrid @ Katowice/Gdańsk & Virtual Poland)
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum skills and experience: BS, MS or PhD in C.S., E.E., or related field5+ years of experience in system SW design and developmentExperience developing high quality code in C/C++, Python, or similar programming languages.Understanding of CPU architecture and system architectureExperience with Unix-like and Windows operating systems, simulators, debuggersKnowledge of operating systems architecture, drivers, multithreaded programming Preferred skills and experience: Understanding of parallel programming models, data structures and algorithms, synchronization methodsAbility to collaborate well with others in an energizing environmentCreative thinking and effective communication.
DESCRIPTION: Intel's XPU Software architecture team is looking for a passionate and dedicated individual to help define and build the next generation of high-performance XPU architectures for Intel. This individual will be a member of the software team developing the run-time environment for executing parallel algorithms for the advanced CPU architecture and will work with XPU architecture engineers and the systems engineering team to create new XPU products and programming models for them. This position will be responsible for developing a set of runtime libraries and API to communicate effectively with the XPU system layer and parallel hardware. You will play an important role in creating the XPU run-time architecture and implementing the system software stack for innovative compute architectures. You will work with the architects and developers of our XPU simulator model and XPU system environment, Intel OneAPI team, pre- and post-silicon verification, and validation team, and help design and develop SW IP for next-generation Intel highly parallel computing systems Behavioral traits that we are looking for: Strong verbal and written communication skills, and clarity in technical communications.Self-starter with the ability to work independently, and an aptitude to learn new things quickly.Ability to work with multi-functional and cross-site groups.Ability to work in a dynamic and team-oriented environmentWhat you'll be doing:Work on the design and implementation of a new run-time system necessary to effectively use the XPU and provide the necessary system environment for the execution of parallel codes.Work on dv-testing and validation of the run-time APISeek interesting and meaningful problems for state-of-the-art CPU and XPU technologies.

TITLE: Quantum Intern Theory and Experiment
QUALIFICATIONS: You must possess the below requirements to be initially considered for this position. Experience listed below would be obtained through relevant training and/or research experience. Minimum Requirements: Candidate must be pursuing a PhD in Physics and/or Engineering and/or Chemistry.3+ years’ experience with the quantum computing devices from either the experimental, theoretical or device modeling perspective.
DESCRIPTION: Quantum computing has the potential to transform the industry by achieving large computational speed-ups over classical computers. Advances in quantum technologies have propelled quantum computing from a theoretical physics field to experimental physics and engineering. Come join us as part of an Intel team exploring quantum computing hardware, specifically spin qubits in silicon. We are looking for either theorists focused on the modeling of quantum circuits or experimentalists focused on building and characterizing spin qubit devices. You will also work with researchers across Intel to tap into the latest findings. The internship will be located in Hillsboro, Oregon during the summer of 2023.

TITLE: Cost and Inventory Business Process Owner (BPO)
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's degree or Master's degree with 10+ years of experience in Finance.5+ years of relevant experience working closely with Cost and Inventory.
DESCRIPTION: The Cost and Inventory (CI) team within Corporate Accounting Office (CAO) is responsible of the design and execution of Intel's inventory processes. We are amid a tremendous amount of change and this role will play a big part into defining and designing the future state of how we operate within Cost and Inventory.As we start Intel's biggest transformation into our IDM 2.0 Foundry model, the Corporate Accounting Office has set a Global Process Owner team within Cost and Inventory to identify and design the systems and process required to meet the new business needs. This is a very exciting opportunity to be front and center as we enable Intel's future!The Business Process Owner (BPO) is a key role within the Cost and Inventory Global Process Owner Office (GPO) responsible for definition, design, implementation, and adoption of Cost and Inventory processes, systems, and policies for specific domain areas across the enterprise. The Business Process Owner is responsible for global process and systems standardization and optimization, and accelerating automation of specific domain areas in the Cost and Inventory function while developing a future vision.The Operations Finance Business Process Owner will play a critical dedicated role in delivering the Cost and Inventory GPO's modernization vision and priorities as we transform the way we deliver information, building flexible solutions to support the business today and in the future.Key responsibilities include, but will not be limited to: Operations Finance Process Design: understands the end to end processes standards, data hierarchy, variations, pain points, systems, and control environment, and can translate this knowledge into deliverables and plans that meet objectives. Understands the as-is state, defines the desired to-be state and identifies process improvement opportunities to streamline, eliminate, standardize and automate process for specific domain areas within the Cost and Inventory function by aligning and collaborating closely with operations and other stakeholders to achieve desired end state. Goal would be to create and scale efficiency across the company.Cost Strategy and Policy: develop solutions to move stakeholders closer to future state by defining objectives and standards for policy, processes, systems with an operational lens that will drive business insight and value.Business Sensing: proactively tackling business challenges (e.g., Inventory Reserves) by building strong relationships with factory and business units to address via policy, system, management escalation. Success in this role requires the following skills/expertise: Problem-solving: identify core process breakdowns, analyze potential causes, prioritize pain points and identify options to implement the most effective solutions. Understand customer needs and innovate to serve and solve customer and business needs - rationalized for what is essential for the organization.Subject Matter Expertise: deep understanding of Cost and Inventory subject matter along with Operation Finance supporting factories or business units to help identify pain points and critical needs.Business Partnering: build strong relationships with stakeholders and operational teams to align priorities, synchronize process improvement plans, lead, and engage the right experts to design across functions, and influence recommended changes to optimize the end-to-end process.Communication skills: effectively communicate across multiple stakeholders including Finance, Information Technology, Accounting, Audit, Legal, and other stakeholders. Skills to present concise and impactful messages to leaders.

construction contractors, etc to look for pull in opportunitiesWork directly with the schedulers from the various general contractors and design build teams to evaluate and monitor schedule risks indicators.Establish, implement and adhere to Schedule Change Control process including review and agreement of impact of project and scope changes to ensure control is incorporated in the overall project schedule and progress measurement system.Accumulate and access historical data for use in maintaining realistic future planning and forecasting The candidate should possess the following behavioral traits: Proficiency working in a fast paced environment with multiple customers and stakeholders.A team player, inquisitive, self-starter with a keen eye for details and ability to learn quickly. #FCE #CProjEng

TITLE: New Mexico Process Engineer undergrad intern
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum Qualifications: Must be pursuing a BS degree in Electrical Engineering, Photonics, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Optoelectronics, Optics, Physics, Material Science, or similar technical engineering discipline.3+ months of experience with programs such as Python, MS office, Power Bi, Statistical Analysis.3+ months of experience with design of experiment (DOE)Maintain a minimum 3.0 GPA throughout the studentship.This position is not eligible for employment-based visa/immigration sponsorship. Intel sponsors individuals for employment-based visas for positions where we experience a shortage of US Workers. These skills shortage roles are typically STEM contributing positions requiring a Master's or PhD degree, or a Bachelor’s degree with three years’ related job experience. This position does not qualify for Intel Sponsorship because it is either (1) a non-STEM contributing position, or (2) a STEM position that only requires a Bachelor’s degree and less than three years’ experience. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge of substrate manufacturing.Programming knowledge especially Python.Experience in photonics, optoelectronics, optical transceiver components, semiconductor physics and/or device physics is a plus.Experience in failure analysis techniques.
DESCRIPTION: Intel New Mexico’s Disaggregation ManufacturingOrganization is looking for highly motivated students to sustain, ramp, and transfer new technologies using state of the art equipment and materials. This is a Part Time (minimum 20 hours per week) year-round student program while attending school full-time with the ability to work on-site at our Rio Rancho campus. You must be actively enrolled in school and not graduated to work as a student intern. We are targeting students that are within 18 months of graduation, preferably within their last year. Process Engineer job responsibilities will include, but are not be limited to: Sustaining day-to-day operations across all shifts to deliver best-in-class results for tool availability.Cycle time.Defects and parametric performance.Process Engineers design and plan the layout for such processes as hardening, washing, laminating, etching, engraving, polishing, painting, plating, and other material processing operations.Hands-on participation with frequent factory floor presence is expected. The ideal candidate should exhibit the following behavioral traits: Excellent teamwork and leadership skills.Strong problem solving and prioritization skills with attention to detail.Good communications skills. You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

TITLE: Senior Analog Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: Minimum qualifications are required to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field plus 10+ years of relevant experience or a Master's degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering, Computer Science or related field with 8+ years of relevant experience. experience in SOC/IP high speed IO analog/mixed signal circuit design including: In depth hands on experience in designing, testing and validating analog and/or mixed signal circuits with sub-micron CMOS technology. Strong experience in high speed IO circuit design in any of these areas: Rx, Tx, LDO, PLL, DLL, and clocking circuits. Solid understanding of deep sub-micron device physics, process technology and manufacturing. Knowledge of analog layout techniques, including floor-planning, matching, shielding and parasitic optimization. Strong background in VLSI and industry standard CAD tools for schematic capture, simulation, layout and physical verification (examples: Cadence adexl, Spectre/Ultrasim/AMS Designer /Virtuoso). Preferred Qualifications: Experience in mixed signal IP design. Good communication and leadership skills Requirements listed would be obtained through a combination of industry relevant job experience, internship experiences and or schoolwork/classes/research.

TITLE: Hardware Backend Team Lead
QUALIFICATIONS: 5+ years of experience in System on Chip Hardware BackEnd designBSc in Electrical engineering from known UniversityDeep understanding of construction flow: Synthesis, Place&Route, LO verificationDeep understanding of signoff activities (STA, Power integrity verification, Reliability verification, IR drop and Cross Talk analysis )Deep understanding of formal verification tools , mainly for logic equivalent verification (LEC)Deep understanding of clocks distribution and implementation techniques in block levelExperience in design for power techniques - advantageExperience in high frequency design convergence - advantageExperience in full chip activities (routing, clocks, STA) - advantage

Group is implementing a variety of design styles, from high frequency blocks to high cell count designs and routing channels.

TITLE: Senior Project Manager - Off-Site Manufacturing (OSM)
QUALIFICATIONS: You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates. Position not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship. Minimum Qualifications: The candidate must have at least one of the following: Bachelor's degree of Science in Engineering or related field with the following years of experience:10+ years of experience in Off-Site Manufacturing (OSM) or module construction.5+ years of experience in modularization or OSM development including concept and strategy, execution plan development and implementation. 20+ years of experience in support of major high tech construction projects will be considered in lieu of a degree.
DESCRIPTION: Join our Intel Fab Construction Enterprise (FCE) who builds the world's largest semiconductor manufacturing factories across the globe. The future is what we build. Our enterprise manages a portfolio of capital projects on-site with a large contractor workforce that encompasses outsourced general contractors, A/E Architecture and Engineering firms and key trade companies in the Semiconductor Construction Industry. The scope of our work includes but is not limited to Progressive Build, tool install and new factories and site infrastructure. We are looking for world class diverse technical talent to join our team. If you enjoy working with the latest technology in a rewarding, fast-paced environment, this is the right place for you. Everywhere you go, you'll find an opportunity to make a difference. In any given workday, you will be given responsibility to innovate and create an impact to our business. This is an Intel Contract Employee (ICE) position and the location is Phoenix, AZ and relocation assistance will be provided. As a Senior Project Manager - Off-Site Manufacturing (OSM) your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: Own, execute and deliver OSM Scope of Work on the assigned project.Work closely with Project Director and interact with other Project Managers to meet overall project objectives and requirements including safety, cost, and schedule targets.Work closely with Global OSM Manager to meet overall OSM KPIs, support global OSM strategies and initiatives, including OSM repeatability, critical path relaxation, new OSM opportunity identification, new OSM product development, OSM best practices, and OSM lessons learned.Define Project OSM Scope and develop Project OSM Execution Strategies and Plan.Work closely with design teams, supply chain management and logistics to move construction scope to more efficient supplier-based or offsite fabrication facilities.Provide guidance to OSM or module engineering design methodology, develop OSM or module fabrication process and installation sequence.Lead, oversee and supervise all OSM activities in entire project cycle from pre-construction planning to module shops/yards fabrication and assembly to site installation and commissioning.Interact and interface with other functions and effective communication and problem-solving to OSM-related engineering, procurement, fabrication, and construction issues.Manage design-build General Contractor and Subcontractors (OSM related), OSM Suppliers or module fabrication yards including onboarding, alignment, project review and health check, progress monitoring and driving, change management and problem-solving.Develop OSM technical bidding package and participate OSM Supplier and Module Yard (MY) selection and provide recommendations in decision making process.Work closely with on-site construction team, traffic and logistic teams in planning OSM/module job site and road/river/ocean transportation routes from MY to Jobsite.Influence and collaborate the design teams to identify key scopes capable of being manufactured offsite or jobsite proximity.Act as champion offsite construction HSE activities and work closely with HSE Lead to meet safety goals.Drive QA/QC team to overview/inspect module fabrication quality, testing and packaging before staring transportation to Job site.Manage and implement risk mitigation planning for OSM/module DESCRIPTION: Manufacturing Equipment Technicians perform electrical or mechanical troubleshooting to determine problems in non-functioning electro-mechanical equipment used in the manufacturing process. Dismantles, adjusts, repairs, and assembles equipment according to layout plans, blueprints, operating or repair manuals, rough sketches or drawings. May also perform set-up, calibration, and preventative maintenance on production equipment. Assignments are semi-routine in nature. Work performed within generally defined parameters. Some degree of judgment required in resolving non-standard problems. Normally receives general instructions on most work. Your day-to-day schedule will be full of amazing opportunities. As a Manufacturing Equipment Technician, you will be: Operating, maintaining, and repairing, and troubleshooting specialized processing equipment inside a clean room environmentCollecting data and communicating results to engineering teams to optimize equipment and process ​Performing complex tasks such as equipment installation, qualification, and troubleshooting​Solving problems with impact on factory performance and efficiency A successful candidate must be willing to: Regularly lift loads up to 25 lbs.Wear closed toe shoes for the duration of shift. Walk 3-5 miles and stand or sit for up to 9 hours within a shift. Push carts for a distance of at least 500 m Climb and perform work on ladders or at heights. Spend the majority of work time (more than 90% less break time) in a clean room environment working on tool sets, processing wafers, and standing or sitting for extended periods of time.Work in a clean room environment wearing a gown, hood, booties, safety glasses and gloves for the duration of shift, with the possibility of using airline-supplied respiratorsWork on a night or day shift compressed work week schedule. Shifts are twelve hours long and alternate between three and four days a week. Perform detailed inspection tasks.Use job specific fixtures, basic hand tools, and potentially airline supplied respirators. This job posting is applicable for entry level Manufacturing Equipment Technician and compensation will be adjusted accordingly. This position is not eligible for Intel immigration sponsorship.

If you are passionate about computer graphics and want to work with leading graphics researchers on Intel's latest GPU/CPU architecture, then AXG has opportunities for you. Your responsibilities could involve but not limited to: Conduct research devising new techniques in real-time 3D rendering under the guidance of an Intel graphics researcherImplement and analyze new real-time rendering algorithms or other highly parallel algorithms.Potentially impact Intel graphics hardware and software products and publication in industry or academia. We're looking for graphics explorers who are collaborative and team oriented with strong written and verbal communications skills, ready to follow ideas and findings where-ever they take you to innovate and make a difference with Intel real-time graphics. Come join us. Behavioral traits that we are looking for: Willing to comprehend and analyze rendering literature.

TITLE: RTL Verification Engineer
QUALIFICATIONS: BS degree in Electrical/Computer/Software Engineering or equivalent and 5+ years of relevant industry experienceWorking knowledge in developing SystemVerilog-based simulation testbenchesWorking knowledge with UVMKnowledge of embedded software design flows and implementation would be a plus.Familiarity with RiscV, Nios II or ARM-based embedded software development environments would be a strong plus.Tcl, Perl, and/or Python scripting skillsDedication to customer experience and usabilityGood written and oral communication skills
DESCRIPTION: As an RTL Verification Engineer within the Design Creation and Debug Group, you can expect to work on validating PSG's System-on-Chip integration tool, Platform Designer, with responsibilities covering a variety of IP components spanning from Memory Mapped and Streaming Interconnect blocks, microprocessors & microcontrollers and an assortment of components supporting embedded FPGA design and debugging flows. The charter of this team is to make implementing powerful embedded hardware systems a straightforward and enjoyable task from design creation through debugging and performance optimization. The team is responsible for the full stack of these tools from GUI, model and OS specific device drivers, soft-core processor design, hardware generators and hardware IP components. We have the fortune of interacting in the highly dynamic space encompassing programmable hardware design, embedded system creation, processor design and embedded software development; designing tools and infrastructure to empower design engineers across these realms. As a Verification Engineer in this position, you will need to be an expert in SystemVerilog, with a focus on authoring and using UVM-based testbenches. Our validation space is non-traditional in that we guarantee functionality across limitless permutations of adaptation modes and modules with our soft-NOC interconnect and as such our validation strategies employee high degrees of scalable and programable dynamicness. With this dynamicness, expertise in various scripting languages (perl, python, tcl), and the willingness and ability to learn, are a critical requirements. Familiarity with C, Java or other high-level languages is a plus. Some larger projects we’re undertaking include: Conceiving, designing and implementing reusable test frameworks for IPCreating testbench generators for complex, highly-parameterizable IPCreating regression tests for IP components: functional, integration, static analysisMeasuring throughput, latency, and other quality-of-results metrics of IP components, and communicating those resultsValidating home-grown microprocessor implementationsValidating FPGA debugging IP and software We’ve assembled an energetic team of quality people and are looking for a couple more experienced engineers to help with the effort. Verifications engineer will have a direct influence on the quality of our hardware implementations, and our ability to innovate rapidly while maintaining stable functionality. Tasks include the following: Work closely with hardware designers to develop test frameworks that meet their needsWrite regression tests for complex parameterizable IP componentsResearch, define, and validate key customer use cases and design flowsCreate reference RTL designs and embedded systems to validate components and software projectsCreate, develop and use in-house measurement tools for tracking progressUse Intel FPGA design tools like our customers to identify usability and productivity problems or missing featuresUtilize the Platform Designer system design tool and accompanying software toolchain for Intel’s FPGA soft processors and ARM-based SoC solutions

QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelors or Masters degree in Electrical, Electronics or Computer Engineering with 10-15 years of relevant industry experience including at least 5 years of pre-Si Validation experience Relevant ASIC design/validation experience in front end processes including RTL functional, performance and power verification Good knowledge of digital logic design, chip architecture and microarchitecture. Strong leadership skills and has the ability to work independentlyExpertise in verification of design blocks (IP) for system-on-chip (SoC) componentsExpertise in System Verilog and OVM or UVM based verification methodologiesExperience in OOP concepts, coverage based random validationExperience in one/more of the following areas PCIe, USBKnowledge of scripting, SVA, UPF validationKnowledge of IO interconnect, memory controllers, CPU architecture is a plusKnowledge of considerations for performance, power and cost optimization is desirableExperience with advanced verification techniques such as formal and assertions a plus.Needs to be a key team player, while being highly energetic and motivated, independent and self-driven
DESCRIPTION: The Graphics and Throughput Computing Hardware Engineering (GTCHE) Division, within the IAGS (Intel Architecture, Graphics and Software) Supergroup, is responsible for design and development of Graphics, Media and Display IPs as well as discrete Graphics SoCs (GPUs), targeting both Client Device and Datacenter markets. The GTCHE organization is at the center of Intel’s push into the discrete Graphics SoCs market segment targeting next-generation applications such as High-performance Exascale computing, Deep learning / training, Cloud Graphics, Media analytics, High-end gaming, etc. In this position you will be part of a world-class Silicon design organization working with a team of highly talented engineers working on cutting-edge IP/SoC architectures, advanced Silicon design and process technologies, with tremendously exciting opportunities for industry-leading engineering innovations.
